hedline.hl1: Magazine Offers A Cold War Tour

abstract.p: American Heritage magazine, inspired by popularity of its D-Day tour, plans to offer its first Cold War tour of Berlin and Dresden, Germany, and Prague, Czech Republic, from September 20 to 30 (S)

block.p: Call it a look behind the Iron Curtain: American Heritage magazine, inspired by the popularity of its first D-Day tour last year, will offer its first cold war tour Sept. 20 to 30. It traces the origins of the cold war with visits to Berlin and Dresden in Germany, and to Prague. Francis Gary Powers Jr., the son of the U-2 pilot shot down by the Soviets in 1960, will lecture the group.

The tour costs $3,899 a person, double occupancy, and includes air fare from New York. The American Heritage tours are organized by Historic Tours, a company specializing in World War II trips. Call (877) 992-8687 or (800) 222-1170. On the Web, it's www.americanheritage.com; for Historic Tours, www.ww2tours.com.
